alert.note: Alert for Hoke; Moore; Richmond; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 4:55PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...An area of training showers and storms will impact portions of south central Moore, central Scotland, southeastern Richmond and central Hoke Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 453 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy and nearly stationary showers and storms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Hoffman to near Wallace. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. Training storms may produce localized flooding. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Localized flooding from training showers and storms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southern Pines, Rockingham, Pinehurst, Hamlet, Aberdeen, Hoffman, Pinebluff, Dobbins Heights, Gibson and Laurel Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of these storms. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
